I like this movie, and own the blu-ray version. But the UHD version from Lionsgate is poorly authored and not worth buying. The HDR blacks are actually about 5% grey, leaving the black letterbox visible and grey, but not black. Also if you stop the movie playback your display is left with HDR on more often than not. All these problems are due to poor HDR authoring by the studios. In this case (along with Ender'sGame) Lionsgate has produced two UHD discs that should be avoided at all costs.

The second disk, DVD not 4K, had a number of sound dropouts where nothing could be heard, neither the dialog nor the sound effects.  This is very disappointing for a Blu-ray offering.  I do not have a 4k machine or TV, so I was not able to assess the quality of that disk.  The packaging and online info states 4k, Blu-ray and Digital HD.  However, I only received two disks in the case and one was 4k while the other did not say blu-ray.  This discrepancy may be intentional or accidental, but it is misleading in either case.
The biggest disappointment was the sound problem!

This is a great addition to the Expendables franchise, especially in 4K!  The film is totally action packed and filled with great chase scenes and action sequences.  If you loved the first two movies you will definitely be into this one.  And if you happen to have a 4K set up, even better.  The film pops with color and the Dolby Atmos soundtrack will rock your speakers.  Great fun, great movie!
Awesome movie with awesome actors and a great movie for fans of action packed movies. Stallone even has his own clothing line at slystalloneshop.com
This was my least favorite out of the trilogy but itnis still a decent movie.

If the love The Expendables, then this is the movie for you. A lot of fun with a lot of action. Not meant to be a serious movie by any stretch of the imagination but great entertainment nonetheless. I wish he would make a 4 and 5.

I have now bought 2 copies of this 4K UHD disc, the first is almost unwatchable - blue haze, no blacks, lousy color (Oppo UDP 203, Samsung 8000 UHD TV) the image on the second one was only marginally improved - flesh tones were often grey.  The movie looked better on the blu ray, which we put on to finish watching the movie.  Based on our experience cannot recommend buying the 4K version, unless we are the only unfortunate people to buy two bad copies of this movie?  This is not a review of the movie itself, read other reviews for that.
